results.title: Silent pioneers
results.brief_description: Through intimate profiles eight men and women, this film offers a portrait of the 3.5 million gay and lesbian elders in the USA. Contrary to the public stereotype of a youthful homosexual community, gay men and lesbians do grow old. This is a portrait of strong and active women and men who face not only issues of ageing, but also concerns related to sexual orientation. This film intimately profiles eight men and women

results.title: Silent Night: Story of a Christmas carol
results.brief_description: Dramatises the story of how “Silent Night” was originally written. Beginning with a wandering group pf American carollers, the story slips back to Austria in 1818. In the little town of Aberndof, Father Mohr, the vilalge priest, was struck with the beauty of Cristmas Eve and wrote a Christmas poem. His friends, Franz Gruber, the teacher-choirmaster, composed musisc for the poem and the song spread over Austria until it became a Christmas carol, popular in every corner of the globe.

results.title: Silent fiction films
results.creator_credit: BFI, National Film Archive (Australia) and Williamson Kinematograph Co
results.brief_description: Four films made by the Williamson Kinemagraph Co. ‘Attack on a Chinese Mission’ (1900) an incomplete drama in which a missionary defends his family against Chinese Boxers; ‘Fire’ (1901) a drama about a house fire showing a policeman raising the alarm, a horse-drawn fire engine and various occupants being saved; ‘The Reservist before and after the War’ (1902) depicts a man receiving a summons to prepare for service in the army and his circumstances after the war; ‘An Interesting Story’ (1905) a comedy about a man so absorbed by his book that he doesn’t notice what he’s doing.

results.title: Silence speaks: digital storytelling project
results.creator_credit: ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling US
results.brief_description: The content has been created as part of the “Silence Speaks” project, an international movement that provides the survivors of violence and abuse with an opportunity to tell their own stories. A co-production between ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling (US) to coincide with Real Life on Film. “Silence Speaks” represents the most recent examples of Australian documentary making.

results.title: Silage: A New method
results.brief_description: The method of vacuum fodder conservation, and its advantages. A stack is built on a black plastic groundsheet, inside a steel forming-ring which rises as the stack is built. A plastic dome is spread over the stack, sealed to the groundsheet and the air is then pumped out. The dome is removed and the consolidated stack covered with a plastic cover. This method of making silage adaptable to farm routine, permits conservation of difficult crops and involves minimum labour and waste of fodder.

results.title: Signs of trouble. Aspects of delinquency. Ep. 2. We hate school (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Gordon Croton and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Truancy and disruptive behaviour at school are on the increase. This program looks at the causes and possible solutions. This second part of the series, Signs of Trouble, was shot in Britain and the USA, and introduced by Laurie Taylor, Professor of Sociology at the University of York.

results.title: Signs for safety
results.brief_description: Describes clearly the different road signs and their meanings. Divides them into four classes - regulatory, warning, information, and temporary devices. In the Materials Research Laboratory, C.R.B. head office, signs are tested for efficiency, durability and reflecting power. Stresses the need for motorists to recognise and obey the signs.
